title: Twin of monster who murdered girl, 15, punches pregnant wife in savage attack
text:

The twin of an evil murderer who butchered a teenage girl punched his pregnant wife in a violent rage as she held a baby.

George Leathem, whose brother John killed Paige Doherty in a sickening knife attack three years ago , attacked Amie Leathem at their family home when she was two months pregnant.

She arrived home to find Leathem, a convicted sex offender, drunk and trying to bottle feed a six-month-old baby.

Amie took the child, who can't be identified for legal reasons, away from him and fed the tot herself, before placing the youngster in a highchair.

But her partner lashed out, punching Amie several times in the back.

And the 35-year-old subjected her to more violence later, as she held the baby in the kitchen. Amie, the baby and Leathem were left bloodied in the ordeal in August this year.

(Image: Daily Record)

Sentencing Leathem to nine months in jail at Paisley Sheriff Court, Sheriff David Pender said: "This is an appalling offence.

"To do this to your wife while she's carrying a child and is pregnant defies belief as far as I'm concerned."

The court heard Leathem hurled homophobic insults and threats of violence at police officers as they arrested him and took him to the police station.

"I'll f****** end you, ya f****** p****! Get that c**k out your mouth. I've ended better than you," he told one officer in Erskine, near Glasgow.

The traumatised victim called 999 herself after the rage.

Procurator Fiscal Depute Maureen McGovern, prosecuting, said: "The accused and the lady have been together for four years and have been one year married.

"The lady is pregnant.

"She came home from work at 5.45pm, to discover the accused to be heavily under the influence of alcohol, sitting on the couch, attempting to bottle feed a baby.

"She saw he was unable to do this because he was so intoxicated, and removed the child from him and fed her by herself.

"He punched her several times on the back.

(Image: PA)

"She took the decision to make herself limp, believing that would be the best way for him to loose his grip - and that worked.

"She ran to the living room and grabbed the child and her phone and immediately phoned 999."

Speaking in relation to the further violence in the kitchen, the lawyer added: "He punched her directly in the face, causing her nose to burst and bleed heavily.

"Indeed, blood went everywhere - sadly, not only on her, but also the young child and also the accused.

"She recoiled in horror and attempted to shield the child as he continued to assault her by punching her several times to her head and neck."

(Image: PA)

The defendant admitted assaulting his wife and behaving in a threatening or abusive way towards the police officers who went to arrest him, while a charge of threatening his wife, banging on the door of the property and demanding entry was dropped.

Since the attack, Leathem had been working in a whisky bond, switched jobs because of his alcohol problems, was already on a Community Payback Order and subject to a deferred sentence in other cases.

The court heard he has a long criminal history.

His brother John was jailed for life for the shocking slaying of Paige. The killer stabbed Paige 61 times, leaving her with 146 knife wounds, in a fit of rage in his deli.
description: George Leathem, whose brother John butchered teenager Paige Doherty in Clydebank, Scotland, battered his newlywed wife, Amie Leathem
